enumerate:
\begin{enumerate}
\item
There is a one-parameter family of solutions.
This parameter $\beta$ corresponds to the initial value
of tachyon field.
\item
For $\beta =0$, the tachyon stays at the unstable perturbative vacuum:
\begin{equation}
t(x;\beta=0 )=0.
\end{equation}
\item
There is a specific value $\beta_c$ of $\beta$.
At $\beta =\beta_c$ the tachyon field is
independent of time and stays at the tachyon vacuum:
\begin{equation}
t(x^0;\beta_c)=t_c.
\end{equation}
\item
For $0<\beta <\beta_c$, the tachyon evolves in time and
asymptotically approaches the tachyon vacuum $t_c$:
\begin{equation}
t(x\rightarrow\infty ;\beta\neq 0 )=t_c.
\end{equation}
\
